alert.note: Alert for North Central Mountains; Northwest Plateau; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 02 at 1:42PM MDT until April 03 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM UNTIL 8 PM TODAY FOR THE NORTHEAST AND CENTRAL HIGHLANDS AS WELL AS THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 9 PM MONDAY FOR MUCH OF NORTHERN AND WESTERN NM BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM MONDAY TO 9 PM TUESDAY FOR ALL OF EASTERN NM DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE AND POOR HUMIDITY RECOVERY... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 9 PM TUESDAY FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND THE SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .An extended period of critical fire weather will impact much of the region through Tuesday. The focus will be across eastern NM today before spreading to the entire region Monday. Critical fire weather will persist through Monday night into Tuesday across all of eastern New Mexico and redevelop over parts of central NM by Tuesday afternoon. Winds will finally taper off Tuesday night with very cold temperatures and higher humidity to alleviate critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 9 PM MDT MONDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 9 AM to 9 PM MDT Monday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101), West Central Mountains (Zone 105), West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109), Upper Rio Grande Valley (Zone 121), North Central Mountains (Zone 120) and the Sangre de Cristo Mountains (Zone 122) from 9 am to 9 pm Monday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west winds 25 to 40 mph with gusts of 50 to 60 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values between 10 and 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: North Central Mountains; Northwest Plateau; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains
